{"id":1249662051,"question_id":3402,"lang":"java","lang_name":"Java","time":"1 month, 1 week","timestamp":1714881453,"status":11,"status_display":"Wrong Answer","runtime":"N/A","url":"/submissions/detail/1249662051/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Minimum Cost to Equalize Array","memory":"N/A","code":"class Solution {\n    public int minCostToEqualizeArray(int[] nums, int cost1, int cost2) {\n       \n        \n        \n        int max = 0;\n        for(int n : nums)\n             max= Math.max(max, n);\n        \n        int len = nums.length;\n        int[] need = new int[len];\n        \n        for(int i=0; i<len; i++){\n            need[i] = max - nums[i];\n        }\n        \n        int M = (int) 1e9+7;\n        long[] dp = new long[len+1]; // minimum cost to make the first i element zero\n        dp[1] = need[0]*cost1 %M;\n        \n//         if(need[i-1]==0) dp[i] = dp[i-1]\n//         if(need[i-1]>0)  dp[i] = Math.min( dp[i], dp[i-1]-cost1+ cost2);\n        //  [0, 3], cost1 = 5, cost2 = 2\n        // dp[1] = 0\n        // dp[2] = 20 - 5 +2\n        \n        \n        for(int i=2; i<=len; i++){\n            dp[i]= dp[i-1];\n            \n            if(need[i-1]>0){\n                \n                dp[i] = Math.min(dp[i], (dp[i-1]-(cost1*need[i-1]%M)+ (cost2*need[i-1]%M))%M);\n                \n            }\n        }\n        \n        return (int)dp[len]%M;\n        \n        \n        \n        \n             \n             \n    }\n}","compare_result":"","title_slug":"minimum-cost-to-equalize-array","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
